intro: Navia maguirei var. minor, commonly known as the lesser Navia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
